option.value: Improving your use of knowledge or application skills

string_table.name: pxabnsnfns11111110111
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

slidelink.displaytext: Introduction Slide
Breaking Down Use of Knowledge Questions
Breaking it down example
Options case study or simulation
Simulation options
Case Study options
Digestion
Digestion 1
Food nutrient that amylase breaks down?
Where is amylase found in the digestive system
Moving on to digestion 2
Digestion two
What were your observations?
Digestion three
What were your observations?
Digestion four
What were your observations?
Digestion five
Make a guess. What do you think will happen with the benedict solution test?
Digestion six
Intro to experiment explanation
Explain why the different colour changes were seen after the test with the benedict solution
From your results in which pH does amylase work best in?
Why does amylase work best in the mouth and in the small intestines?
Basic knowledge
Name the enzymes found in the stomach
Name the enzymes found in the small intestines
Now that you have named the enzymes. Lets match the enzymes to the functions
Digestion application
You had a ham sandwich for lunch. Where in the digestion would the sandwich be broken down. Explain your answer.
If your liver is not working why should you cut down on your intake of fatty foods?
Explain to Kristen the scientific principle by which the dica worked to treat the problem.
EXIT COURSE
The fooballer
The Footballer
Footballer at the doctor
Video instruction
Video on balanced diet
Now that you have watched that interesting video lets see what you would have gathered. So, what is a balanced diet and what must be looked at when considering balanced diets for individuals?
Footballer calling doctor
Footballer at home
Below are three meal plans that are high in different nutrients. From your research select which meal plan would be best for Joseph?
Now its time to explain why meal options A or C is the best choice for Joseph.
Name two other food nutrient that Joseph can add to his diet to make it more balanced and explain why those nutrients were selected.
Moving on
Which menu option that is best suited for a an athlete and carpenter?
Now explain why option C is the best menu for the Joseph
Below is a list of criteria for selecting food. Select the TWO MOST important criteria for Ms. Lee, Joseph’s grandmother.
Now, explain why vitamins and minerals, and softness of food are correct when selecting food for Ms. Lee.
Grandma and grandchild
Below is a list of criteria for selecting food. Select the TWO MOST important criteria for Ms. Lee, 5 year old grand child.
Now, explain why vitamin and mineral content as well as energy content is important to consider when selecting food for a 5 year old?
Final footballer
EXIT COURSE
The Farmer
The Farmer
Review help
What is the science concept needed here?
Food groups and types of food that the nutrient can be found in?
Putting it together Give the type of foods groups that should be in the farmers diet and why.
Moving on to menu options
Now that you have thought outside the box and placed it all together look at the images below and select which menu would be the best option for our farmer
Fully explain why menu C is the correct menu option for the farmer
Farmer and wife at home
Farmer and wife at the doctor
Farmer and wife at the doctor continue
Food Nutrients that should be eating in extra amounts by a pregnant woman
After doing some research on nutrients and benefits for her and baby during pregnancy. The farmer’s wife decided to try and match nutrients to the benefits. See if you can help her.
Now that you have matched the nutrients to the benefits, let’s look at the food sources to go with each nutrient.
Which menu option that is best suited for a pregnant woman?
Give the reason for the menu B option being the best suited for a pregnant woman?
From your research conducted, what will your body do if you do not take in enough calcium and what will happen to you?
Untitled Slide

Let us put it all together in the form of an essay to give the doctor on the research that was done. In the essay you are required to name at least 5 nutrients needed by the mother, the benefits of the nutrients and the food sources for the different nutrients.
EXIT COURSE
Food Test
Food test 1
Science concepts for food test
Benedict solution is used to test for which nutrient? Just name the nutrient
Iodine is used to test for the presence of which nutrient? Just name the nutrient
Biuret reagent is used to test for what food nutrient? Just name the nutrient
Ethanol can be used to test for which food nutrient? Just give the name of the nutrient
Food test experiement intro two
Food test experiment part 2
Explain why the air hole should be adjusted to change the flame of the Bunsen burner.
Food test part 3
Lab application
A blue black colour change in the test done with iodine indicates what?
A purple colour change in the test done with protein indicates what?
What does the observation with the test done using benedict solution mean?
What does the observation with the test done using the ethanol mean?
Teenager and body builder
Would cashew nuts be a good food source for body builders to include as a snack? Remember to give a reason for your answer
As a teenager who is very active what food nutrients should you eat a lot of and why?
Your mother made dinner for you. The meal consisted of baked chicken and bread. Is this a balanced meal for you and give a reason for your response.
Introduction to gandma
Body and grandmother
Food nutrient that grandma should increase and why. Examples of the food she needs to eat.
Commendation food test
EXIT COURSE

search.slidetext: integrated science improving use of knowledge/ application skills click below to enter: enter enter enter enter enter enter

breaking down use of knowledge questions 1. think of the science concepts that can apply 3. link the science concept to the situation 2. select the best concept to match the situation 4. let’s make the answer flow
example of how to break it down
scientific concepts that might match are: osmosis, diffusion, active transport, passive transport
simulation simulation simulation simulation simulation simulation case study case study case study case study case study case study which door should i take which door should i take
simulation food test food test food test food test food test food test digestive system digestive system digestive system digestive system digestive system digestive system which one to select
case study the farmer the farmer the farmer the farmer the farmer the farmer the footballer the footballer the footballer the footballer the footballer the footballer
effects of ph of salivary amylase experiment
type your response here: food nutrient that amylase breaks down?

where is amylase found in the digestive system mouth mouth mouth mouth mouth mouth large intestines large intestines large intestines large intestines large intestines large intestines stomach stomach stomach stomach stomach stomach small intestines small intestines small intestines small intestines small intestines small intestines
those were your basic introductory questions. now that you are finished with those, lets get back to the experiment.
type observations here what were your observations?
type observations here what were your observations?
type observations here what were your observations?

make a guess. what do you think will happen with the benedict solution test? test tube a will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube a will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube a will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube a will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube a will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube a will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube b will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube b will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube b will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube b will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube b will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube b will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube c will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube c will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube c will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube c will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube c will be the one that shows the most sugar test tube c will be the one that shows the most sugar
now its time to explain what happened during the experiment. then put it in everyday situations.
type your text here explain why the different colour changes were seen after the test with the benedict solution
from your results in which ph does amylase work best in? neutral neutral neutral neutral neutral neutral alkaline alkaline alkaline alkaline alkaline alkaline acid acid acid acid acid acid
type your response here why does amylase work best in the mouth and in the small intestines?
lets look at some basic question before we go into the use of knowledge area. ready? lets go go, go!

name the enzymes found in the stomach pepsin pepsin pepsin pepsin pepsin pepsin trypsin trypsin trypsin trypsin trypsin trypsin amylase amylase amylase amylase amylase amylase peptidases peptidases peptidases peptidases peptidases peptidases

name the enzymes found in the small intestines pepsin, amylase pepsin, amylase pepsin, amylase pepsin, amylase pepsin, amylase pepsin, amylase amylase, lipase, pepsin amylase, lipase, pepsin amylase, lipase, pepsin amylase, lipase, pepsin amylase, lipase, pepsin amylase, lipase, pepsin amylase, lipase, trypsin amylase, lipase, trypsin amylase, lipase, trypsin amylase, lipase, trypsin amylase, lipase, trypsin amylase, lipase, trypsin amylase, trypsin, maltase amylase, trypsin, maltase amylase, trypsin, maltase amylase, trypsin, maltase amylase, trypsin, maltase amylase, trypsin, maltase
now that you have named the enzymes. lets match the enzymes to the functions trypsin breaks down proteins amylase break down starch pepsin breaks down proteins lipase breaks down fats
now that you have the basic knowledge. lets apply that basic knowledge to every day situations.
type your response here: you had a ham sandwich for lunch. where in the digestion would the sandwich be broken down. explain your answer.

now that you have identified where some nutrients are broken down in the digestive. tell me why should a person whose liver is not functioning properly not eat foods that have fats in high concentration.
type your response here: if your liver is not working why should you cut down on your intake of fatty foods?
kristen and her sister riley went into the kitchen to get some food to eat. kristen began to tell her sister about how she has been feeling lately
type your response here: explain to kristen the scientific principle by which the dica worked to treat the problem.

always remember the steps 1. identify the science concepts that might match 2. based on the situation select the best science concept 3. link the science concept to the situation 4. put it all together so that it flows follow these steps and you will never fail your use of knowledge questions again

restart course restart course restart course having mastery of use of knowledge skills is very important as it is a heavily weight grading criteria for your cxc examinations. i am happy you took the time out to follow the guidelines and practice using the skill. as they say practice makes perfect! thanks for completing the course exit course certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate

the footballer joseph miller is one of the best footballers in antigua. he plays for one of the top teams in the premier league. to be on top of his game he has to train every day for at least 3 hours. added to his training he must ensure that he eats a balanced diet to ensure that he maintains a healthy body. joseph does not know what that means so he decides to visit his doctor as his coach advised.

hi joseph, your coach told me that you have got a new job as a carpenter, which is excellent. but it means you have added more to your plate. from my records i see you train everyday as well. so tell me how are you coping? how are you feeling?
watch the video closely and see if you can assist joseph in explaining what is a balanced diet.

type your response here: now that you have watched that interesting video lets see what you would have gathered. so, what is a balanced diet and what must be looked at when considering balanced diets for individuals?

hi james thanks for the call happy to hear what you have found out so far about balanced diet and what must be considered when determining balanced diets for individuals. now i want you to look at the nutrients that are required for you.
let me check the books given by dr. francis to see if i find any information on nutrients.

below are three meal plans that are high in different nutrients. from your research select which meal plan would be best for joseph? meal plan ‘a’ which is high in starch meal plan ‘a’ which is high in starch meal plan ‘a’ which is high in starch meal plan ‘a’ which is high in starch meal plan ‘a’ which is high in starch meal plan ‘a’ which is high in starch meal plan ‘b’ which is high in protein meal plan ‘b’ which is high in protein meal plan ‘b’ which is high in protein meal plan ‘b’ which is high in protein meal plan ‘b’ which is high in protein meal plan ‘b’ which is high in protein meal plan ‘c’ which is high in starch and fats meal plan ‘c’ which is high in starch and fats meal plan ‘c’ which is high in starch and fats meal plan ‘c’ which is high in starch and fats meal plan ‘c’ which is high in starch and fats meal plan ‘c’ which is high in starch and fats
type your response here: now its time to explain why meal options a or c is the best choice for joseph.
type your response here: name two other food nutrient that joseph can add to his diet to make it more balanced and explain why those nutrients were selected.
you are doing great so far in helping joseph. lets continue to work with joseph on this case

which menu option that is best suited for a an athlete and carpenter? menu a seasoned yam rice potatoes banana salad buttered-dinner rolls vanilla cake menu c baked chicken buttered dinner rolls yam pie rice sliced apples oranges menu b milk creole fish stewed liver white rice oranges green salad
type your response here: now explain why option c is the best menu for the joseph
now that joseph knows about balanced diets, and understands what he needs to eat he decides to do further research on what is the best criteria for selecting food for his 75 year old grandmother

below is a list of criteria for selecting food. select the two most important criteria for ms. lee, joseph’s grandmother. colour of food colour of food colour of food colour of food colour of food colour of food vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content quality of food quality of food quality of food quality of food quality of food quality of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food softness of food softness of food softness of food softness of food softness of food softness of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food
type your response here: now, explain why vitamins and minerals, and softness of food are correct when selecting food for ms. lee.
grandma lee wants you to find out what criteria she must use when selecting food for her 5 year old grandchild, since you helped joseph to find out about hers.

below is a list of criteria for selecting food. select the two most important criteria for ms. lee, 5 year old grand child. colour of food colour of food colour of food colour of food colour of food colour of food vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content vitamin and mineral content quality of food quality of food quality of food quality of food quality of food quality of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food energy content of food softness of food softness of food softness of food softness of food softness of food softness of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food packaging of food
type your response here: now, explain why vitamin and mineral content as well as energy content is important to consider when selecting food for a 5 year old?

type your response here: it’s time to put it all together. since we have identified different science concepts and give explanations based on joseph’s case. it is time to write an essay outlining what type of food joseph would need in his diet so that he can play, work and train . also explain what he must think about when preparing foods for ms. lee and her grandchild.

restart course restart course restart course having mastery of use of knowledge skills is very important as it is a heavily weight grading criteria for your cxc examinations. i am happy you took the time out to follow the guidelines and practice using the skill. as they say practice makes perfect! thanks for completing the course exit course certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate

hi there i am mr. james and i am a farmer in the village of all saints. here i am on my farm on a regular day. on the farm i have livestock and a vegetable garden. i would work from 6 am to 4 pm every day ensuring that the farm runs efficiently.

the farmer i face a problem and i need your help. i tend to get tired very easily when doing my daily activities on the farm and i do not know why when i think i eat properly. my daughter told me that i am not eating the right types of foods since i am eating mainly chickens from my farm and vegetables from my wonderful garden. i thought this type of food was good for me. please help me! hint hint hint hint hint hint
chicken provides proteins that builds and repairs body tissues back back back back back back
type your response here what is the science concept needed here?
type response here food groups and types of food that the nutrient can be found in?
type your response here putting it together give the type of foods groups that should be in the farmers diet and why.
excellent work so far! now lets look at menu plans and see if we can select correct menu options for your farmer. ready, lets go!

now that you have thought outside the box and placed it all together look at the images below and select which menu would be the best option for our farmer menu a baked chicken broccoli green salad stewed red beans menu b fried fish lentil peas stew steamed vegetables green salad menu c baked chicken broccoli green salad green bananas and pumpkin salad menu d baked chicken fried dumplings broccoli cold slaw
type your response here fully explain why menu c is the correct menu option for the farmer
this is the farmers wife jamie. she has some news for her husband
hello mr. and mrs james, how are you doing today

the results show that you are indeed pregnant thus you need to learn about correct diet for yourself and the baby so that you can stay healthy during the pregnancy and deliver a healthy baby. but instead of me telling you what you will need to do, i am going give you a set of books and you are going to research and come back and tell me what you found out.

food nutrients that should be eating in extra amounts by a pregnant woman fats and oils fats and oils fats and oils fats and oils fats and oils fats and oils carbohydrates carbohydrates carbohydrates carbohydrates carbohydrates carbohydrates fibre fibre fibre fibre fibre fibre vitamins and minerals vitamins and minerals vitamins and minerals vitamins and minerals vitamins and minerals vitamins and minerals protein protein protein protein protein protein

after doing some research on nutrients and benefits for her and baby during pregnancy. the farmer’s wife decided to try and match nutrients to the benefits. see if you can help her. fats and oils development of baby’s brain and cells vitamin c helps in the absorption of iron, which is needed for formation of placenta and red blood cells. it is also important for development of healthy bones and gums. carbohydrates provides energy for the mother and the baby protein helps in the development of cells and muscles of the growing baby. folic acid allows for complete development of baby’s spine and the formation of red blood cells

now that you have matched the nutrients to the benefits, let’s look at the food sources to go with each nutrient. protein eggs, fish, peas and beans fats and oils nuts, eggs, avocado calcium and vitamin d milk, broccoli, sardines vitamin c cherry, tomato carbohydrate sweet potato, pasta, rice

which menu option that is best suited for a pregnant woman? menu a seasoned yam rice potatoes banana salad buttered-dinner rolls vanilla cake menu c baked chicken buttered dinner rolls yam pie rice sliced apples oranges menu b milk creole fish stewed liver white rice oranges green salad
type response here give the reason for the menu b option being the best suited for a pregnant woman?
type your text here from your research conducted, what will your body do if you do not take in enough calcium and what will happen to you? hint hint hint hint hint hint
back back back back back back

type your response here let us put it all together in the form of an essay to give the doctor on the research that was done. in the essay you are required to name at least 5 nutrients needed by the mother, the benefits of the nutrients and the food sources for the different nutrients.

restart course restart course restart course having mastery of use of knowledge skills is very important as it is a heavily weight grading criteria for your cxc examinations. i am happy you took the time out to follow the guidelines and practice using the skill. as they say practice makes perfect! thanks for completing the course exit course certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate
lets identify the science concept behind chemicals used in food tests
type your answer here: benedict solution is used to test for which nutrient? just name the nutrient
type your response here: iodine is used to test for the presence of which nutrient? just name the nutrient
type your response here: biuret reagent is used to test for what food nutrient? just name the nutrient
type your response here: ethanol can be used to test for which food nutrient? just give the name of the nutrient
now that we have looked at and answered those questions, lets get back to the experiment
type your response here: explain why the air hole should be adjusted to change the flame of the bunsen burner.

now that you have completed the lab lets engage in some application or use of knowledge. as we go through the practice always remember the steps. 1. identify the possible science concepts 2. selecting the right science concept 3. link the science concept to the situation

a blue black colour change in the test done with iodine indicates what? absents of starch in the food absents of starch in the food absents of starch in the food absents of starch in the food absents of starch in the food absents of starch in the food presents of starch in the food presents of starch in the food presents of starch in the food presents of starch in the food presents of starch in the food presents of starch in the food

a purple colour change in the test done with protein indicates what? absents of protein in the food absents of protein in the food absents of protein in the food absents of protein in the food absents of protein in the food absents of protein in the food presents of protein in the food presents of protein in the food presents of protein in the food presents of protein in the food presents of protein in the food presents of protein in the food
type your response here: what does the observation with the test done using benedict solution mean?
type your response here: what does the observation with the test done using the ethanol mean?

so now you know that cashew nuts contains fats, protein and starch. 1.as a teenager who is very active what food nutrients should you eat a lot of and why? 2. would cashew nuts be a good food for body builders to include as a snack?
type your response here would cashew nuts be a good food source for body builders to include as a snack? remember to give a reason for your answer
type your response here as a teenager who is very active what food nutrients should you eat a lot of and why?
type your response here: your mother made dinner for you. the meal consisted of baked chicken and bread. is this a balanced meal for you and give a reason for your response.
so lets see what is coming next. are you ready? lets go!
after conducting the lab and telling grandma about what you did,she mentioned that she was having cramps and constipation. she was wondering if it had to do with something she was eating.
type your response here: food nutrient that grandma should increase and why. examples of the food she needs to eat.
excellent work in the lab and with the application of knowledge gained

restart course restart course restart course having mastery of use of knowledge skills is very important as it is a heavily grading criteria for your cxc examinations. i am happy you took the time out to follow the guidelines and practice using the skill. as they say practice makes perfect! thanks for completing the course exit course certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

resource.url: story_content/external_files/The main nutrients needed by the body.pdf
resource.title: Nutrients needed by the body
Importance of calcium for pregnant woman

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Doctor Francis why do I always feel so tired. I know I can play better but I just do not have the energy that I use to have before taking up the new job
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="I face a problem, and I need your help. I tend to get tired, very easily when doing my daily activities on the farm, and I do not know why, when I think I eat properly. My daughter told me, that I am not eating the right types of foods since I am eating mainly chickens from my farm, and vegetables from my wonderful garden. I thought this type of food was good for me. Please help me!" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Correct response is. Food nutrient that provides energy, which is carbohydrates" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Nutrient can be found in the food group, staples, and in starchy foods such as ground provisions for example yams, potatoes, cassava. it can also be found in bread, rice and pasta. Click continue after comparing responses." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Compare your response to the one below.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="This is a basic outline, of what should be in your response.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Foods include carbohydrates, as they are needed to provide him with the energy needed to perform all his tasks. He also needs proteins, to build and repair his body tissues, that would become damaged from all the hard activities he is involved in. He would also need fruits, and vegetables, that would provide him with vitamins, and minerals, to help maintain a healthy body system.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click continue, when you are finished comparing your responses." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" Justification="Center" /> <Span Text="Menu C is a fully balanced meal. It contains the nutrients that the farmer would need to carry out his daily activities. It contains carbohydrates, that is needed to provide energy. It contains proteins, to repair torn muscles and body tissues and it contains vegetables that would provide vitamins, and minerals for healthy life. It also contains fibre, that prevents constipation. When you have completed the review of your response click continue" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

terms.term: Foods from the food groups to suit a persons age, gender and physical activity
There are six caribbean food groups which are staples, food from animal sources, vegetables, fats and oils, legumes, fruits
Eating too much or too little of the required portions of food from the different food groups
